sub_title: Hydrogen Mobility Product Development Team Lead at Shell
summary: I am an integrative leader who drives the use of new technology to deliver value to the business and society. I have a passion for technology, and particularly enjoy the intersection of technology and the business, where technology can create value for the business, while the business informs the technology needs.

profile_positions.description: Leading a team that develops and deploys new product offerings for Shell's Hydrogen Mobility business.
profile_positions.title: Hydrogen Mobility Product Development Team Lead

profile_positions.description: Led a research team that developed and deployed technologies to improve recovery from gas injection and waterflood developments.
profile_positions.title: Manager Enhanced Gas Injection & Waterflood Technology

profile_positions.description: Reservoir engineering support for thermal EOR development in a Shell-ExxonMobil joint venture, including project forecasting, reserves reporting, and coaching responsibilities.
profile_positions.title: Senior Reservoir Engineer, Schoonebeek

profile_positions.description: Managed WRFM budget, while leading a multi-disciplinary team to optimise production within numerous system constraints in a Shell-ExxonMobil joint venture.
profile_positions.title: Well, Reservoir, and Facilities Management Lead Schoonebeek

profile_positions.description:
Responsibilities
- Agenda setting and ensure smooth execution of VP visits to assets, projects, and locations in a Shell-ExxonMobil joint venture.
- Assistance in content preparation for internal and external engagements.
- Support clarity and consistency in VP priorities in communications, meeting agendas, etc.
- Assist with leadership and extended leadership team meetings - agenda setting, co-ordination of pre-read, minute taking, and action tracking.
- Support effective communication between VP and direct reports.  

Skills
- Integration of diverse views.
- Prioritization and execution of activities in the context of business goals, in an organization with both license-to-operate and cost challenges.
- Influencing without direct authority.
profile_positions.title: Business Advisor to the Director of the NAM

profile_positions.description:
Responsibilities
- Agenda setting and ensure smooth execution of EVP visits to countries, projects, and locations.
- Assistance in content preparation for internal and external engagements.
- Support clarity and consistency in EVP priorities in communications, meeting agendas, etc.
- Assist with leadership and extended leadership team meetings - agenda setting, co-ordination of pre-read, minute taking, and action tracking.
- Support effective communication between EVP and direct reports. 
- Support hand-over from out-going to in-coming EVP.  

Skills
- Integration of diverse views.
- Prioritization and execution of activities in the context of business goals, in a technology organization that supports the wider business.
- Influencing without direct authority.
profile_positions.title: Business Advisor to the Chief Technology Officer

profile_positions.description: Experiments to improve understanding of alkaline-surfactant-polymer flooding, including core floods to assess wettability and initial oil saturation effects and in situ measurement of microemulsion rheology. Lead enhanced experimentation programme to improve accuracy and shorten time needed for alkaline-surfactant-polymer experiments. Conducted screening study to identify candidate fields for chemical enhanced oil recovery. Worked with team members from Emerging Technologies, Chemometrics and Statistics, Rock & Fluids, and Higher Order Olefin Derivatives to deliver research outcomes relevant to the Enhanced Oil Recovery team. Facilitation of subject matter expert workshops.
profile_positions.title: Reservoir Engineer, Enhanced Oil Recovery Team

profile_positions.description: Intern in biotechnology team. Experimental examination of microfluidic flows and development of microfluidic tools for biomedical applications.
profile_positions.title: Intern, Biotechnology Group

profile_positions.description: Research assistant in Weitz lab. Fabrication of microfluidic devices using soft lithography techniques. Encapsulation of cells in drops using microfluidic devices. Study of effects of geometry in two-phase flow including the suppression of Rayleigh-Plateau instabilities and effects of inertial flow on colloidal particles using high speed photography, optical microscopy and MATLAB and ImageJ image analysis. Development of microfluidic devices for studies of nucleation and for microwave heating of drops.
profile_positions.title: Research Assistant, Weitz Lab

profile_positions.description: Organized intellectual and cultural events in Harvard University's Graduate Student Center.
profile_positions.title: Intellectual & Cultural Fellow, Dudley House

profile_positions.description: Supervised undergraduate students undertaking 10-week-long summer projects. Responsibilities included formulation of project, teaching experimental techniques and necessary background, guidance in experimental enquiry, assistance with final paper and presentation.
profile_positions.title: Research Experience for Undergraduates Mentor, SEAS

profile_positions.description: Analysis of bacteria using scanning electron microscopy and fluorescent dyes. Microfabrication of microelectromagnets using photolithography and electron beam lithography. Calculations of magnetic fields due to microelectromagnets using Mathematica.
profile_positions.title: Research Assistant, Westervelt Lab

profile_positions.description: Core class for non-majors with limited mathematical background. Taught one 15 person section, graded problem sets, papers, and exams, created exam and problem set questions.
profile_positions.title: Teaching Fellow, Science A-41 "The Einsteinian Revolution"

profile_positions.description: Core class for non-majors with limited mathematical background. Taught one 15 person section, graded problem sets, papers, and exams. Was head teaching fellow and as such administered scheduling of students in sections, collection of grades, and assignments for other teaching fellows.
profile_positions.title: Teaching Fellow, Science A-49 "Time"

profile_positions.description: Created and modified models in Matlab pertaining to the reading and writing of patterned recording media. Used models to determine design parameters for magnetic read and write heads, as well as for recording media. Assisted with characterization of samples using Kerr Microscopy and Vibrating Sample Magnetometry.
profile_positions.title: Co-op/Pre-Professional Engineer, Patterned Media

profile_positions.description: Introductory physics for non-majors with little mathematical background.  Supervised laboratory component of class and graded students lab books for approximately 10 students.
profile_positions.title: Tutor, Physics 140

profile_positions.description: Theoretical models were examined in an effort to better understand the physical mechanisms that underpin local current peaks which are experimentally observed in magnetic tunnel junctions. Examined a one-dimensional free electron model, as well as a tight-binding model, which was implemented using non-equilibrium Green's function formalism. Models were implemented using Mathematica 4.1 and Fortran 77.
profile_positions.title: Honours Student, Stamps Group

profile_positions.description: Determined operational parameters of two modules acquired by IBM for conductive atomic force microscopy. Became familiar with the operation of a Digital Instruments scanning probe microscope as an atomic force microscope, magnetic force microscope, and conductive atomic force microscope. Studied tunnel behaviour in aluminum oxide film barriers formed by plasma and natural oxidation. Developed analysis routines using Igor Pro. Determined optimal barrier thickness for films formed with natural oxidization barriers based on minimizing spatial fluctuations in tunnel currents while maximizing magnetoresistance.
profile_positions.title: Summer Internship, Recording Heads

profile_positions.description: Investigated magnetic force microscopy techniques and applications using a Digital Instruments magnetic force microscope.
profile_positions.title: CSIRO Student Research Scheme, HighPerm Lab

volunteer_experiences.description: Ranking of abstracts submitted for consideration in annual symposium. Review of papers for annual symposium.
Participation in recruitment events for technical students and professionals on Shell's behalf.

company.name: MentorNet, a division of Great Minds in STEM

volunteer_experiences.description: Mentor to technical female students in eMentoring program me.
Mentor to technical students and interns.
Mentor to incoming international students in the Graduate School of Arts & Sciences.
Acted as "Big Sister" to incoming physics graduate students. Provided information regarding the PhD program, course work, Harvard, and living in Boston.
Attended the joint meeting of the National Black Physicists Society and the National Hispanic Physicists Society to assist physics department recruitment of minority graduate students.
Women in Science Mentors Program. Mentor sophomore physics majors. Assisted with matching of students and mentors.
Organized monthly screening of movies for physics community.
Attended weekly informal meetings. Helped to organize food and guest speakers.

Visited schools in  Perth metropolitan area and south-west rural Australia to present engineering as a career option to 10th grade students. Talked to groups of approximately 30 students in the top mathematics and science classes.  Received training in presenting information, and in using demonstrations, overhead projections, and video footage as presentation aids.

Assisted and advised first year engineering students to help ease the transition to university. Trained in leading groups. Worked with co-mentor to coordinate group meetings, and deal with issues of concern to first year students.
Lead mentoring circle on "Influencing" for NAM's Women Network.
